title: Benjamin Faneuil Dunkin
text: Benjamin Faneuil Dunkin was a chief justice on the <a href="South%20Carolina%20Supreme%20Court">South Carolina Supreme Court</a>. He was born in <a href="Philadelphia">Philadelphia</a>, <a href="Pennsylvania">Pennsylvania</a> on December 2, 1792; graduated from <a href="Harvard%20University">Harvard University</a> when he was eighteen; and moved to <a href="Charleston%2C%20South%20Carolina">Charleston, South Carolina</a> in 1811. He was elected to the South Carolina House of Representatives and served as its Speaker in 1828 and 1829. Between 1865 and 1868, he was Chief Justice of the South Carolina Supreme Court. He died on December 5, 1874, at his home in Charleston, South Carolina. He is buried at Magnolia Cemetery, Charleston, South Carolina.
